case_vignette: A 35-YEAR-OLD WOMAN PRESENTS TO THE DERMATOLOGY CLINIC WITH INFLAMMATION OF HER FINGERNAILS THAT FIRST APPEARED 5 MONTHS AGO AND RECENTLY WORSENED. SHE REPORTS WEARING ACRYLIC NAILS FOR THE LAST YEAR, REMOVING THEM JUST BEFORE THE CLINIC VISIT. ON EXAMINATION, THE PATIENT HAS ERYTHEMA AND SWELLING OF THE LATERAL NAIL FOLDS AND HYPERPIGMENTATION OF THE PROXIMAL NAIL FOLDS OF ALL FINGERS ON HER RIGHT HAND. EXAMINATION ALSO REVEALS NAIL DYSTROPHY, ONYCHOLYSIS, AND AN ABSENCE OF CUTICLES. SHE HAS NOT TRIED ANY TREATMENTS FOR THIS CONDITION.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've got redness and swelling around my fingernails, some color change near the base of the nails, and my nails look deformed. Also, the nails are detaching from the bed and the skin at the base of my nails is missing.
Have you experienced any trauma to your nails or hands recently?
No, I haven't experienced any trauma to my nails or hands recently.
Do you have a history of any systemic illnesses such as diabetes or psoriasis?
No, I do not have a history of systemic illnesses like diabetes or psoriasis.
Are you currently taking any medications, or have you recently taken any antibiotics or chemotherapy drugs?
No, I am not taking any medications and haven't recently taken any antibiotics or chemotherapy drugs.
Have you been exposed to water or chemicals frequently due to your occupation or hobbies?
I've been wearing acrylic nails for the last year, which might involve exposure to some chemicals during application and removal.
Final Diagnosis: Acrylic nail-induced onycholysis and paronychia.
